    • Method Detail

      • getPathAsList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPathAsList()
        Returns a List representation of path component in the request.
        Basically, a request path kind of /module-name/action/action-param-1/action-param-N will be split by the "/" character.
        Specified by:
        getPathAsList in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        a list of substrings

      • getModuleName

        public java.lang.String getModuleName()
        Retrieves requested module name out of the URL path.
        In a request path like /module-name/action/etc it's the first part of the string, separated by the "/". If the path is empty, it's assumed that the app's index module has been requested.
        Specified by:
        getModuleName in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        a module name (always in lower case) or 'index', if it is not provided by a client

      • getActionName

        public java.lang.String getActionName()
        Retrieves requested action out of the URL path.
        The action name is the second part of a request path kind of /module-name/action/action-param/etc. If the action is absent, it's assumed that module's index action has been requested. Dashes and underscores in action name will be removed and replaced with camel case, e.g. my-action-name becomes myActionName.
        Specified by:
        getActionName in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        the exact action (a method to be invoked) name or 'index', if no action is provided

      • getActionNameAsRequested

        public java.lang.String getActionNameAsRequested()
        Description copied from class: FilteredHttpRequest
        Retrieves requested action name out of the URL path. Unlike getActionName() this method returns almost unfiltered action name (in lower case).
        Specified by:
        getActionNameAsRequested in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        the exact action name or 'index', if no action is provided

      • getActionParams

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActionParams()
        Retrieves a List of action parameters from the URL path.
        Every third and the following substrings of a request path kind of /mudule-name/action/action-param-1/action-param-2/etc are considered to be action parameters.
        Specified by:
        getActionParams in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        a list of action parameters or empty list, if no parameters were found

      • isAjax

        public boolean isAjax()
        Description copied from class: FilteredHttpRequest
        Whether or not the request is an AJAX (XMLHttpRequest) request.
        Specified by:
        isAjax in class FilteredHttpRequest
        Returns:
        true if the request is an AJAX request, false otherwise
